DOC.brief_summary: This randomized-controlled open-label trial compare two different dos low-molecular-weight heparin ( LMWH ) pregnant patient history previous venous thromboembolism ( VTE ) . Both dos recommend dos 2012 guideline American College Chest Physicians ( ACCP ) , know dose efficacious prevent recurrent venous thromboembolism pregnancy . Patients enter study randomize soon home test confirm pregnancy . LMWH administer 6 week postpartum . Follow-up continue 3 month postpartum . Patients recruit treat physician , either obstetrician internist .
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Low Intermediate Dose Low-molecular-weight Heparin Prevent Recurrent Venous Thromboembolism Pregnancy
DOC.criteria: Age : 18 year old , ; Pregnancy confirm urinary pregnancy test , ; Gestational age < 14 week , ; Previous objectively confirm VTE , either unprovoked , presence use oral contraceptive estrogen/progestagen use , related pregnancy postpartum period , minor risk factor ( e.g . long distance travel , minor trauma ) . Previous VTE relate major provoking risk factor ( e.g . surgery , major trauma plaster cast immobilisation 3 month prior VTE ) sole risk factor , ; Indication treatment therapeutic dose anticoagulant therapy ( e.g . treatment acute VTE ; permanent use therapeutic anticoagulant outside pregnancy ) , ; Inability provide inform consent , ; Any contraindication list local labelling LMWH .
